ygData.subject: Re: Fletching costs
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t have any actual chart or anything that says it....but from my experance, Fletching is still much cheaper to raise than Smithing, which is much cheaper
ygData.messageBody:
I don't have any actual chart or anything that says it....but from my experance, Fletching is still much cheaper to raise than Smithing, which is much cheaper than raising jewlcraft, everybody I know is whining because it now cost more to raise your fletching skill.....start up an enchanter and try raising jewlcraft....then complain about the cost of raising a skill :)

>>> "Ben Sarsgard (1)" <bens@...> 6.17.99 9:48:33 AM >>>
From: "Ben Sarsgard (1)" <bens@...>

Yeah, it does blow, but if you think about it, fletching was highly imbalanced before the patch. I've only ever done tailoring and a little blacksmithing, but I've found fletching drastically easier than either. For tailoring, you need to spend so much time hunting for pelts, then shell out 6 silver for a pattern, just to get one chance. I tailored on and off for about a week, and only got my skill up to 16, then I took up fletching, and, after 2 nights, i had it up to 65. It's clearly more balanced now, but I'm a little pissed that they waited this long to fix it. They should have recognized it in beta, so there wouldn't be the aforementioned 200 skill fletchers running around who those of us whom are not yet masters can pretty much never hope to reach.

Slig of povar

>>> Doug Sorensen <belgarth_of_surefall@...> 06/15 2:16 PM >>>
From: Doug Sorensen <belgarth_of_surefall@...>


We have been talking about this in the Ranger mailing
list and you don't get any more chances for your
money.

You only get a skill check per bunch of 5 arrows. if I
recall the prices for the items went up. The most
basic tip was 1 copper and went to 6 copper for the
ability to make 5. A raw deal for sure as some people
went to near 200 with a much lower cost.

Belgarth Wolfstrider

Message: 5
Date: Mon, 14 Jun 1999 15:42:52 PDT
From: Vytautas Dwarf/Paladin
<vytautasthedwarf@...>
Subject: I'm at skill 160 and wasting Plat like crazy


Before the patch my skill was 159. At this skill lvl I
was using a (field,
wooden, ceramic, large) bundle/combination to raise my
skill. After the
patch I decided to try to raise my skill some more. I
wasted close to 40
plat after selling the made arrows back to the NPC to
raise my lvl to 160. I
had to buy 30 bundles (costing about 3.5 plat a
bundle) to raise my skill
one point. Therefore, I am wondering, since
everything now costs 5 times as
much, do we get 5 times the chance to raise our skill
with each try? I
don't believe so, since that would have given me 150
tries to raise my lvl 1
point. Am I right? or am I doing something wrong?
